creator: Victor Vansteenkiste
title: Measuring Finger Positions on a Violin With ESP32
materials_required: Raspberry Pi with an SD card
description: This project aims to create a tool that accurately displays finger positions on a violin using an ESP32 to read data from linear softpots placed on the violin. The ESP32 sends the data wirelessly to a Raspberry Pi, which stores the data and hosts a website to visualize the finger positions.
steps: Connect the softpots to the ESP32 by connecting the left and right pins to 5V and GND respectively. Connect the middle pin to an analog pin and a 10k ohm resistor connected to GND.
Connect the ESP32 to the computer using a micro USB cable and upload code using Arduino IDE after installing the ESP32 Arduino core.
Write code to assign pins and read data from the softpots using analogRead(). Store the values in a list.
Connect the ESP32 and Raspberry Pi wirelessly using the websocket library. Modify the MD5.c and MD5.h files, and delete the avr/io.h lines in the sha1 files to enable usage with the ESP32.
Write code for the ESP32 to connect to WiFi, read softpot data, and send it to the Raspberry Pi using websockets.
Write Python code for the Raspberry Pi to receive the data from the ESP32 using the websocket library.
Set up a database on the Raspberry Pi using mariadb.
Create a website using Flask and a form in HTML to start and stop data recording.
Connect the website to the database using flaskext.mysql and create functions to get and set data.
Implement threading in the Flask application to allow simultaneous recording and other tasks.
Configure a service to run the website from the Raspberry Pi.
Optionally, connect an LCD screen to the Raspberry Pi to display the IP address for accessing the website, creating a service for the LCD screen to start on boot.
